## override data cleaning

Read xlsx file to Rdata and show the data structure.

```{r data}
library(tidyverse)
library(foreign)
library(readxl)
library(here)

filepath <- getwd()
setwd("C:/Users/Gang Chen/OneDrive - University at Albany - SUNY/r-projects/mass-override")

override <- read_excel(here::here("data", "override.xlsx"))
head(override)

debt_ex <- read_excel(here::here("data", "debt_exclusion.xlsx"))
head(debt_ex)

capital_ex <- read_excel(here::here("data", "capital_exclusion.xlsx"))
head(capital_ex)

stable_ex <- read_excel(here::here("data", "stable_exclusion.xlsx"))
head(stable_ex)

#ratings_moody <- read_excel(here::here("data", "bondratings_moody.xls"))
#head(ratings_moody)

#ratings_sp <- read_excel(here::here("data", "bondratings_sp.xls"))
#head(ratings_sp)

```

You can add options to executable code like this

```{r}
abtowns <- override |> 
  filter(Municipality == "Acton" | Municipality == "Boxborough")

abtowns

```

The `echo: false` option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).
